page.title: 15Law and Order in Eversley
page.content: {P.C. Moore}has been in Eversley for four years. He is our local policeman and he told us about his job. As Eversley is a rural area there is a low level of crime. He receives about six or ten telephone calls a day which involve traffic accidents,thefts, burglaries, assaults, criminal damage, missing people, stray animals, domestic disputes, deaths and indecency offences. P.C. Moore begins his day by calling to see if any crimes or statements have been reported at the office. He has to deal with between fifteen and twenty burglaries a year. His main police station is Farnborough. He uses a motor-bicycle most of the time but sometimes he uses a car. This year he has been to Nottingham to the miners' strike picket lines.
